text: The Obamas announced in May 2016 that Malia Obama had been accepted to Harvard but was taking a gap year. Her 12 months of me time, according to news accounts, featured an extended trip last fall to Bolivia and Peru, a journey reportedly organized by a Boulder, Colo., company called Where There Be Dragons. Eva Vanek, director of admissions for the firm, declined to talk about Malia Obama but spoke generally about its gap-year and summer programs, saying they operated in 19 countries in Asia, Africa and South and Central America.
title: Malia Obama's gap year about to end as she goes to Harvard

meta_data.description: Malia Obama was 10 years old and in the fifth grade when her father became president, and next week she's set to start a new chapter at Harvard.
